Sure, here are some tips and resources for a beginner who wants to learn how to cook French cuisine:

1. Start with simple dishes: Start with simple French dishes before progressing to the more complex ones. You can build your skills gradually and gain more confidence along the way.

2. Follow recipes: Follow recipes closely, especially for the more intricate dishes. French cuisine is precise, and the recipes are often detailed, so take your time and read through them carefully before starting.

3. Invest in good tools: Invest in good quality cookware, especially pots and pans, as French cuisine often requires long and slow cooking processes.

4. Learn the techniques: French cuisine is known for its techniques, so it's essential to learn them. This includes learning how to sauté, poach, braise, and roast. It's also important to master knife skills, as precise cutting and chopping are often required.

5. Take a cooking class: If you're serious about learning French cuisine, consider taking a cooking class. This will give you the opportunity to work with professional chefs, learn techniques firsthand, and ask questions.

6. Resources: There are many resources available for learning how to cook French cuisine. Cookbooks, online tutorials, and cooking shows are all excellent resources to help you learn the basics of French cooking.

Hopefully, these tips and resources will help you get started with learning how to cook French cuisine. Good luck!
